newsitem.title: RUSSIA: Russian Transaero codeshare with AA delayed.
newsitem.headline: Russian Transaero codeshare with AA delayed.

text.p: Russian private airline Transaero said it would postpone a code-sharing programme with U.S. carrier American Airlines, a senior company official said on Tuesday.
Alexander Pleshakov, Transaero chief executive, told Reuters that the code-sharing deal would be postponed due to "technical problems".

"Russian aviation authorities are still delaying approval of the United and Lufthansa code-sharing programmes and we cannot begin the Transaero-American Airlines deal because both agreements depend on each other," Pleshakov said.
United has said it seeks to be involved in Lufthansa's Russian routes.
"We do not refuse to be involved in the deal with AA...but we have two more offers from Western airlines to sign code-sharing," he said, declining to be more specific.
Transaero said last year that the deal with AA would be introduced from April 1.
